00045 MCSpectrum::MCSpectrum( RunInfo &ri ) {
00046    
00047     _spectrum = new EnergySpectrum(ri,"MC-Spectrum");
00048 
00049     // ======================================================================
00050     // open the  MC Events database
00051     
00052 
00053     ifstream simfile;
00054     simfile.open(string(ri.mcdatabase+".simhdr").c_str());
00055   
00056     if (simfile.fail())  {
00057         cout << "Can Not Read MC File" << endl;
00058         throw CriticalAnalysisException("Couldn't open simulation database: '"
00059                                         + ri.mcdatabase + "'" );
00060     }
00061     else
00062         cout << "Reading Monte Carlo Data Set: " << ri.mcdatabase<<endl;
00063   
00064     double x;
00065     MCRecord temprecord;
00066 
00067     cout << "with the following cuts:" << endl;
00068     cout << ri.cuts << endl << endl;
00069     
00070     HillasParameterization param,unscaled_param;
00071     int numsims=0;
00072     ProgressBar prog(0,"Reading Sims");
00073 
00074     // ======================================================================
00075     // Load the simulated events
00076 
00077     // first load the header from the file
00078 
00079     string line;
00080     MCBinInfo tmpbin;
00081 
00082     cout  << "   E_start     E_end    Radius    N_sims" << endl;
00083 
00084     while (getline(simfile,line) && line != "#===END===") {
00085 
00086         if ( line.substr(0,2) == "#>" ) {
00087 
00088             vector<string> token;           
00089             tokenize( line, token );
00090             
00091             if (token.size() != 5) {
00092                 cout << token.size() <<endl;
00093                 cout << "UNKNOWN INFO IN HEADER: "<<line <<endl;
00094             }
00095             else {
00096                 tmpbin.start = atof(token[1].c_str());
00097                 tmpbin.end = atof(token[2].c_str());
00098                 tmpbin.radius = atof(token[3].c_str());
00099                 tmpbin.nummc = atoi(token[4].c_str());
00100                 _info.push_back( tmpbin );
00101                 cout << setw(10) << tmpbin.start 
00102                      << setw(10) << tmpbin.end 
00103                      << setw(10) << tmpbin.radius
00104                      << setw(10) << tmpbin.nummc
00105                      << endl;
00106             }
00107 
00108         }
00109 
00110     }
00111     
00112     if (_info.size() != NUMMCBINS) {
00113         throw CriticalAnalysisException("Bad header in "
00114                                         +ri.mcdatabase);
00115     }
00116 
00117 
00118     cout << "Reading event data from " << ri.mcdatabase << endl;
00119 
00120 
00121     // Read the event data
00122 
00123     ParamDataReader reader( ri.mcdatabase );
00124 
00125     numsims=0;
00126 
00127     EnergyEstimatorFactory *efactory = EnergyEstimatorFactory::instance();
00128     EnergyEstimator *energy = efactory->getEstimator(ri.energyestimator);
00129 
00130     try {
00131         while (1) {
00132 
00133             if(numsims++ % 100==0) prog.print(1);
00134 
00135             reader.getNextEventRecord( param );
00136             x = energy->getEstimate(param.size,param.distance,param.zenith);
00137             temprecord.estimatedEnergy = x;
00138             temprecord.trueEnergy_in_TeV = param.sim.primary_energy;
00139             _event.push_back( temprecord );
00140 
00141 
00142         }
00143     }
00144     catch (EOFException &e) {
00145         cout << "DEBUG: end of file: "<<e.what() << endl;
00146     } 
00147        
00148     prog.printClear();
00149 
00150     simfile.close();
00151 
00152     cout << "Succesfully Read MC File, " << _event.size() <<" of "
00153          << numsims << " events passed cuts" <<endl;
00154 
00155 
00156 }

00159 MCSpectrum::~MCSpectrum() {
00160     delete _spectrum;
00161 }

00165 
00170 void 
00171 MCSpectrum::
00172 fill(double N0, double Gamma0, double E0, double Time) {
00173     
00174     double w;
00175     
00176     // Reset Histogram  
00177     _spectrum->reset();
00178     
00179     double n0 = pow(10.,N0);
00180     
00181     // Loop over MC events, and fill "artifical" energy spectrum
00182     vector<MCRecord>::iterator evt;
00183     for (evt = _event.begin(); evt != _event.end(); evt++){
00184         
00185         w = weight( evt->trueEnergy_in_TeV,n0,Gamma0,E0,Time );
00186         _spectrum->accumulate( evt->estimatedEnergy, w );
00187         
00188     }
00189 
00190 }
00191 
00192 
00196 double MCSpectrum::weight(double energy, double N0, double Gamma0, 
00197                           double E0, double Time) {
00198     
00199     // that's the number of events per time area and energy that we
00200     // want to have
00201     double soll;
00202     if (E0>0){ 
00203         soll = N0*pow(energy,Gamma0)*exp(-1*energy/E0)*Time;
00204     }else{
00205         soll = N0*pow(energy,Gamma0)*Time;
00206     }
00207     double numShower,de,a,e1,e2;
00208     
00209     info(energy,numShower,de,a,e1,e2);
00210     
00211     if (numShower>0) {
00212 
00213         // here we compute the number of events per time area and
00214         // energy that we have simulated some calculus is needed, to
00215         // take into account that we simulated with differential
00216         // spectral index of 1.5.
00217         
00218         double gamma_sim,gamma_red,n0,ist;
00219         
00220         gamma_sim = -1.5;  // should be differential index
00221         // note some versions of Kascade incorrectly call the input
00222         // "integral" when it is actually differnetial!
00223         gamma_red =  gamma_sim+1.;
00224 
00225         // n0 is normalization constant of the simulated differential
00226         // energy spectrum
00227         n0        = -gamma_red * numShower/(pow(e1,gamma_red)-
00228                                             pow(e2,gamma_red));
00229 
00230         ist       = n0 * pow(energy,gamma_sim) / a ;
00231         
00232        // ratio of what we want to have and what we do have is the
00233        // weighting factor
00234         
00235         return soll/ist;
00236     }
00237     else
00238         return 0.;
00239 
00240 }
00241  
00245 void MCSpectrum::info(double energy,double &numShower, 
00246                       double &de, double &a, double &e1, double &e2){
00247     
00248     if ((energy<_info[0].start)||(energy > _info[NUMMCBINS-1].end)) {
00249         numShower = -1;
00250         return ;
00251     }
00252 
00253     int i;
00254     for (i=0;i<NUMMCBINS;i++)
00255         if (_info[i].end >= energy) break;
00256 
00257     numShower = _info[i].nummc;
00258 
00259     // width of energy interval
00260     de        = _info[i].end - _info[i].start;
00261     
00262     // get boundaries of simulation interval
00263     e1        = _info[i].start;
00264     e2        = _info[i].end;
00265     
00266     // area
00267     a         = M_PI * _info[i].radius * _info[i].radius;
00268 
00269  }
00270 
00276 double MCSpectrum::chiSquare( std::vector<Data> &data ) {
00277     
00278     int i;
00279     double chiSquare = 0.;
00280     double diff;
00281     _ndof = -2;
00282     
00283 #ifdef ES_DEBUG
00284     cout << "New Chi^2"<<endl;
00285 #endif
00286     
00287     // loop over bins
00288     for (i=0;i<_spectrum->numBins();i++) {
00289 
00290         // Only use if sum of on and off counts exceeds MIN_COUNTS (5),
00291         // that gurantees nice chi-square statistics
00292 
00293 
00294         if (data[i].onOffVariance>EnergySpectrum::MIN_COUNTS) {
00295             
00296             //   kpk: also only keep points where the value is >
00297             //   sqrt(variance), that way really sick points aren't counted.
00298             //             && data[i].onOff > sqrt(data[i].onOffVariance))  {
00299 
00300            diff       = data[i].onOff - _spectrum->get(i);
00301            chiSquare += diff*diff/(data[i].onOffVariance);
00302            
00303 #ifdef ES_DEBUG 
00304            cout << setw(10) << i << " " 
00305                 << setw(10)<< data[i].onOff << " " 
00306                 << setw(10)<< data[i].onOffVariance << " " 
00307                 << setw(10)<< _spectrum->get(i) << " "  
00308                 << chiSquare<<endl; 
00309 #endif
00310            
00311            _ndof++;
00312        }
00313     }
00314 #ifdef ES_DEBUG
00315     cout << endl <<endl;
00316 #endif
00317     return chiSquare;
00318 }

00320 // ++++++++++++++++++ 
00321 // + Fitter Methods +
00322 // ++++++++++++++++++
00323 
00332 void
00333 Fitter::
00334 minimize( EnergySpectrum* energy_on,EnergySpectrum* energy_off, 
00335           double &N0, double &Gamma0, double &E0, double Time, 
00336           double n0Range, int n0Step, 
00337           double gRange, int gStep,
00338           double e0Range, double e0Step, double onoffratio) {
00339     
00340     int flagE0;
00341     
00342     if(E0>0.0){
00343         flagE0 = 1;
00344     }else{ flagE0 = 0;}
00345 
00346     // check that the histograms sizes are correct:
00347 
00348     if (energy_on->numBins() != energy_off->numBins() ) {
00349         throw CriticalAnalysisException(string("Wrong energy spectrum sizes: ")
00350                                         +"rerun wucut" );
00351     }
00352     if (energy_on->numBins() != _mcSpectrum->getSpectrum()->numBins() ) {
00353         throw CriticalAnalysisException(string("energy spectrum and ") 
00354                                         +"monte carlo spectrum have "
00355                                         + "different sizes: rerun wucut");
00356     }
00357 
00358     // 
00359     // Get information out of histograms
00360     //
00361 
00362     if (_data.size() != energy_on->numBins()) {
00363         _data.resize(energy_on->numBins());
00364     }
00365 
00366     int i;
00367     for (i=0;i<energy_on->numBins();i++){
00368         _data[i].onOff         = (energy_on->get(i)-
00369                                   onoffratio*energy_off->get(i));
00370         _data[i].onOffVariance = onoffratio*(energy_on->get(i)
00371                                              +energy_off->get(i));
00372     }
00373     
00374     // Now we loop 3 times over the data.
00375     // (1) loop over n0 and g to minimized the chi-square value
00376     // (2) loop over n0 to get error on n0
00377     // (3) loop over g to get error on g
00378     
00379     double n0,n1,n2,dn;
00380     n0 = log10(N0);
00381     n1 = n0-n0Range;
00382     n2 = n0+n0Range;
00383     dn = (n2-n1)/n0Step;
00384     
00385     double g,g1,g2,dg;
00386     g1 = Gamma0-gRange;
00387     g2 = Gamma0+gRange;
00388     dg = (g2-g1)/gStep;
00389 
00390     double e0,e1,e2,de;
00391     if (flagE0 == 1){
00392             e0 = log10(E0);
00393             e1 = e0-e0Range;
00394             e2 = e0+e0Range;
00395             de = (e2-e1)/e0Step;
00396     }
00397 
00398     double chiSquare;
00399     _results.chiSquare = 1E+32;
00400     _results.n0        = 0.;
00401     _results.gamma0    = 0;
00402     if (flagE0 == 1){
00403         _results.e0        = 0.;
00404     }else { _results.e0 = -1.;}
00405     
00406     ofstream chiFile("Totals/chi.text");
00407     // TODO: put in a progress bar here!
00408     ProgressBar prog(n0Step,"Fitting");
00409     int tmp=0;
00410     cout << "E0 " << "N0 " << "Gamma "  << "ChiSqr "  << endl;
00411     if(flagE0 == 1){
00412         for (e0=e1;e0<e2;e0+=de){ //loop over E0 to minimize the chisqr value
00413             //cout  <<"E = " << pow(10,e0) ;
00414             //prog.print(tmp);
00415             tmp++;
00416             // (1) loop over n0 and g to minimize the chi-square value
00417             for (n0=n1;n0<n2;n0+=dn){
00418                 
00419                 // Loop over Gamma0
00420                 for (g=g1;g<g2;g+=dg) {
00421                     
00422                     _mcSpectrum->fill(n0,g,e0,Time);
00423                     chiSquare = _mcSpectrum->chiSquare(_data);
00424                     //chiFile << pow(10,n0) << " " << g << " " << pow(10,e0) << " " << chiSquare << endl;
00425                     chiFile << pow(10,e0) << " " << chiSquare << endl;
00426 
00427                     if (chiSquare<_results.chiSquare) {
00428                         _results.chiSquare = chiSquare;
00429                         _results.n0        = n0;
00430                         _results.gamma0    = g;
00431                         _results.e0        = e0;
00432                         cout << pow(10,e0) << " " << pow(10,n0) << " " << g << " " <<chiSquare << endl;
00433                         //chiFile << pow(10,e0) << " " << chiSquare << endl;
00434 #ifdef ES_DEBUG
00435                         cerr << "BEST ChiSqr:  "<<chiSquare
00436                              << " at n0="<<n0<<", gamma0="<<g<<" E0= "<<e0<< "   " <<endl;
00437 #endif
00438                     }
00439                 }
00440                 
00441             }
00442             
00443         }
00444     }else{ 
00445         // (1) loop over n0 and g to minimize the chi-square value
00446         for (n0=n1;n0<n2;n0+=dn){
00447             
00448             prog.print(tmp);
00449             tmp++;
00450             
00451             // Loop over Gamma0
00452             for (g=g1;g<g2;g+=dg) {
00453                 
00454                 _mcSpectrum->fill(n0,g,e0,Time);
00455                 chiSquare = _mcSpectrum->chiSquare(_data);
00456                 chiFile << n0 << " " << g << " " << e0 << " " << chiSquare << endl;
00457                 if (chiSquare<_results.chiSquare) {
00458                     _results.chiSquare = chiSquare;
00459                     _results.n0        = n0;
00460                     _results.gamma0    = g;
00461                     _results.e0        = e0;
00462 #ifdef ES_DEBUG
00463                     cerr << "BEST ChiSqr:  "<<chiSquare
00464                          << " at n0="<<n0<<", gamma0="<<g<<"  " <<endl;
00465 #endif
00466                 }
00467             }
00468                 
00469         }
00470     }
00471 
00472 
00473 
00474     chiFile.close();
00475     prog.printClear();
00476     cout << "Done" << endl;
00477     
00478     ProgressBar prog2( 0,"Error on n0");
00479     cout << "Getting Errors..." << endl;
00480     // (2) loop over n0 to get error on n0
00481     _results.n0P = _results.n0;
00482     _results.n0M = _results.n0;
00483     
00484     for (n0=n1;n0<n2;n0+=dn/10.) {
00485 
00486         prog2.print(1);
00487 
00488         _mcSpectrum->fill(n0,_results.gamma0,_results.e0,Time);
00489         chiSquare = _mcSpectrum->chiSquare(_data);
00490         if (chiSquare<(_results.chiSquare+1)) {
00491             _results.n0P      = GSL_MAX_DBL( _results.n0P, n0 );
00492             _results.n0M      = GSL_MIN_DBL( _results.n0M, n0 );
00493             if (chiSquare<_results.chiSquare) 
00494                 _results.n0 = n0;
00495         }
00496     }
00497     
00498     // (3) loop over g to get error on g
00499     _results.gammaP = _results.gamma0;
00500     _results.gammaM = _results.gamma0;
00501     
00502     prog2.setName("Error on gamma");
00503     for (g=g1;g<g2;g+=dg/10.) {
00504         prog2.print(1);
00505         _mcSpectrum->fill(_results.n0,g,_results.e0,Time);
00506         chiSquare = _mcSpectrum->chiSquare(_data);
00507         
00508         if (chiSquare<_results.chiSquare+1) {
00509             _results.gammaP   = GSL_MAX_DBL( _results.gammaP, g );
00510             _results.gammaM   = GSL_MIN_DBL( _results.gammaM, g );
00511             if (chiSquare<_results.chiSquare) 
00512                 _results.gamma0 = g;
00513         }
00514 
00515     }
00516 
00517     // (2) loop over e0 to get error on e0
00518     if (flagE0 == 1)
00519         {
00520             _results.e0P = _results.e0;
00521             _results.e0M = _results.e0;
00522             
00523             for (e0=e1;e0<e2;e0+=de/10.) {
00524                 
00525                 prog2.print(1);
00526                 
00527                 _mcSpectrum->fill(_results.n0,_results.gamma0,e0,Time);
00528                 chiSquare = _mcSpectrum->chiSquare(_data);
00529                 if (chiSquare<(_results.chiSquare+1)) {
00530                     _results.e0P      = GSL_MAX_DBL( _results.e0P, e0 );
00531                     _results.e0M      = GSL_MIN_DBL( _results.e0M, e0 );
00532                     if (chiSquare<_results.chiSquare) 
00533                         _results.e0 = e0;
00534                 }
00535             }
00536         }
00537 
00538     prog2.printClear();
00539     cout << "Done" << endl;
00540 
00541     //
00542     // Fill the histogram with best fit energy
00543     //
00544     _mcSpectrum->fill(_results.n0,_results.gamma0,_results.e0,Time);
00545 
00546     // TODO: make a histogram of simulated alpha after cuts filled by
00547     // weighting according to best fit parameters similar to the
00548     // fill() function.
00549 
00550 
00551     //
00552     // Fill all results into variables
00553     // 
00554     _results.n0       = pow(10,_results.n0 );
00555     _results.n0P      = pow(10,_results.n0P);
00556     _results.n0M      = pow(10,_results.n0M);
00557     _results.dof = _mcSpectrum->dof();
00558     
00559     N0    = _results.n0;
00560     Gamma0 = _results.gamma0;
00561 
00562     if (flagE0 == 1){
00563             _results.e0       = pow(10,_results.e0 );
00564             _results.e0P      = pow(10,_results.e0P);
00565             _results.e0M      = pow(10,_results.e0M);
00566     }else{
00567             _results.e0       = -1.;
00568             _results.e0P      = -1.;
00569             _results.e0M      = -1.;
00570     }
00571 }
00572 
00577 void Fitter::save() {
00578     
00579     // output _results
00580     // first give fit parameters:
00581     double lower, upper;
00582     cout << endl << endl << "Fit Results" << endl;
00583     
00584     cout << "(chi_s/dof) : ("
00585          << setprecision(3) << _results.chiSquare << " / " 
00586          << _results.dof    << ")"   << endl ;
00587     
00588     lower = _results.n0 - _results.n0M;
00589     upper = _results.n0P - _results.n0;
00590     cout << "N0          :  "<< setprecision(3)<< _results.n0        
00591          << " - " << setprecision(3) << lower 
00592          << " + " << setprecision(3) << upper << endl;
00593     
00594     lower = _results.gamma0 - _results.gammaM;
00595     upper = _results.gammaP - _results.gamma0;
00596     cout << "Gamma0      :  " << setprecision(3) << _results.gamma0  
00597          << " - " << setprecision(3) << lower 
00598          << " + " << setprecision(3) << upper << endl << endl;
00599 
00600     if (_results.e0>0)
00601         {
00602             lower = _results.e0 - _results.e0M;
00603             upper = _results.e0P - _results.e0;
00604             cout << "E0          :  "<< setprecision(3)<< _results.e0        
00605                  << " - " << setprecision(3) << lower 
00606                  << " + " << setprecision(3) << upper << endl;
00607         }
00608     cout << endl << endl;
00609     cout << " N0 low_error  high_error gamma0 low_error  high_error E0 low_error  high_error "  << endl;
00610         cout << _results.n0 << "  " << _results.n0M << "  "  << _results.n0P << "  "  
00611          << _results.gamma0 << "  " << _results.gammaM << "  " << _results.gammaP  << "  " 
00612          << _results.e0  << "  " << _results.e0M << "  " << _results.e0P << endl;
00613     
00614     // Now give fluxes
00615     cout << "Writing Energy Spectrum to file." << endl;
00616         
00617     int i;
00618     double logEnergy,energy,lowerError,upperError,model;
00619     double observed,scaleFactor;
00620     double fluxModel,fluxObserved,error;
00621     ofstream fluxesFile("Totals/espectrum.text");
00622     
00623     fluxesFile << "# energy lowerError upperError data variance "
00624                << "model flux error" << endl;
00625 
00626     for (i=0;i<_mcSpectrum->getSpectrum()->numBins();i++) {
00627         // column output
00628         // (1)-(3) info on energy bin,
00629         // (4) data counts
00630         // (5) error on (4)
00631         // (6) model counts
00632         
00633         _mcSpectrum->getRange(i,lower,upper );
00634         logEnergy   = (lower+upper)/2.;
00635         energy      = pow(10.,logEnergy);
00636         lowerError  = energy-pow(10.,lower);
00637         upperError  = pow(10.,upper)-energy;
00638         model         = _mcSpectrum->get(i);
00639         
00640         fluxesFile << setprecision(6)<< energy << " " 
00641                    << setprecision(6)<< lowerError << " " 
00642                    << setprecision(6)<< upperError << " "
00643                    << setw(5)         << _data[i].onOff << " " 
00644                    << setprecision(6)<< sqrt(_data[i].onOffVariance) << " " 
00645                    << setprecision(6)<< model << " ";
00646         
00647         if (model>0) {
00648             
00649             // strategy: compute model energy spectrum and scale it by
00650             // ratio of predicted counts to observed counts
00651             
00652             observed      = _data[i].onOff;
00653             scaleFactor   = observed/model;
00654             fluxModel     = _results.n0*pow(energy,_results.gamma0)*exp(-energy/_results.e0);
00655             fluxObserved  = scaleFactor * fluxModel;
00656             
00657             if (_data[i].onOffVariance>0)
00658                 error = sqrt(_data[i].onOffVariance)/_data[i].onOff * fluxObserved;
00659             else
00660                 error = 0.0;
00661         }
00662         else {
00663             fluxObserved =0.;
00664             error=0.;
00665         }
00666         
00667         // column output 
00668         // (7) estimated flux for ith bin
00669         // (8) error on (7)
00670         fluxesFile << setprecision(6)<< fluxObserved << " " 
00671                    << setprecision(6)<< error << endl ;
00672     }
00673 
00674     fluxesFile.close();
00675 
00676 }
